Class Visitors

java.lang.Object
nameExtractor.Visitors
public class Visitors extends Object
Utility class containing various JavaParser visitors to collect specific AST elements.

This class provides visitors for:

  • For loops (ForStmt)
  • For-each loops (ForEachStmt)
  • Variable names (NameExpr and SimpleName)
  • Variable declarations (VariableDeclarator)
  • Unary expressions (UnaryExpr)
  • Assignments (AssignExpr)

Provides helper methods to extract these elements from CompilationUnit or specific statements.

    Visitor to collect all simple identifiers (SimpleName) in the AST.
    static class

    Visitor to collect variables involved in unary expressions.
    static class

    Visitor to collect variable names from variable declarations.

  • Method Details

    • handleArrayAccessExpr

      private static void handleArrayAccessExpr(com.github.javaparser.ast.expr.ArrayAccessExpr aae, HashSet<String> assignments)
      Recursively handles array access expressions to extract variable names.
      Parameters:
      aae - the ArrayAccessExpr node to process
      assignments - the set to collect variable names

    • handleFieldAccessExpr

      private static void handleFieldAccessExpr(com.github.javaparser.ast.expr.Expression e, HashSet<String> assignments)
      Recursively handles field access expressions to extract variable names.

      Traverses nested expressions such as method calls, field accesses, and array accesses. Example: obj.field.method()[i] -> collects "obj".

      Parameters:
      e - the Expression node to process
      assignments - the set to collect variable names

    • extractForStmt

      public static HashSet<com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForStmt> extractForStmt(com.github.javaparser.ast.CompilationUnit cu)
      Extracts all traditional for-loops (for statements) from a given compilation unit.
      Parameters:
      cu - the CompilationUnit representing the parsed Java source file
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing all ForStmt nodes found in the compilation unit

    • extractForEachStmt

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a HashSet containing all ForEachStmt nodes found in the compilation unit

      public static HashSet<com.github.javaparser.ast.expr.NameExpr> extractNames(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.BlockStmt bs)
      Extracts all NameExpr nodes (variable references) from a given block statement.
      Parameters:
      bs - the BlockStmt representing a block of code (e.g., method body)
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing all NameExpr nodes found within the block

      Parameters:

      public static HashSet<String> extractVariables(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForEachStmt f)
      Extracts variable names declared within a for-each loop.
      Parameters:
      f - the ForEachStmt node representing the for-each loop
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing the names of all variables declared in the loop

      Extracts all variable names declared within a traditional for-loop.
      Parameters:
      f - the ForStmt node representing the for-loop to analyze
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing the names of all variables declared in the loop

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a HashSet containing the names of all assigned variables within the loop

    • extractAssignments

      public static HashSet<String> extractAssignments(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForStmt f)

      Returns:

    • extractUnaries

      public static HashSet<String> extractUnaries(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForEachStmt f)
      Extracts all unary expressions (e.g., increments, decrements) applied to variables within a foreach-loop. Logical NOT operations are ignored.
      Parameters:
      f - the ForEachStmt node representing the foreach-loop to analyze
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing the names of all variables involved in unary expressions

    • extractUnaries

      public static HashSet<String> extractUnaries(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForStmt f)
      Extracts all unary expressions (e.g., increments, decrements) applied to variables within a traditional for-loop. Logical NOT operations are ignored.
      Parameters:
      f - the ForStmt node representing the for-loop to analyze
      Returns:
      a HashSet containing the names of all variables involved in unary expressions
